text: == Events == * February 2 – Battle of Mortimer's Cross – Yorkist troops led by Edward, Duke of York defeat Lancastrians under Owen Tudor and his son Jasper Tudor, Earl of Pembroke in Wales. * February 17 – Second Battle of St Albans – The Earl of Warwick's army is defeated by a Lancastrian force under Queen Margaret, who recovers control of her husband. * March 4 – The Duke of York seizes London and proclaims himself King Edward IV of England * March 29 – Battle of Towton – Edward IV defeats Queen Margaret to make good his claim to the English throne. Thought to be the bloodiest battle ever fought in England. * Edward, Richard of York's son, crowned as Edward IV, King of England (reigns until 1483) * August 15 – The Empire of Trebizond, the last major Romano-Greek outpost falls to the Ottoman Empire under Mehmed II after a siege of 21 days. * Louis XI of France succeeds Charles VII of France as king (reigns until 1483) * Leonardo da Vinci and Sandro Botticelli become students of Verrocchio * Sarajevo, capital of Bosnia and Herzegovina, is founded by the Ottomans * François Villon: Le Grand Testament * Donatello: Judith and Holofernes
